docs.snippet: Ultra-nationalists are set to return to Serbia's parliament in an April 24 election after an absence of several years, boosted by growing discontent with Prime Minister Aleksandar Vucic's pro-European Union stance and austerity policies....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ultra-nationalists are set to return to Serbia's parliament in an April 24 election after an absence of several years, boosted by growing discontent with Prime Minister Aleksandar Vucic's pro-European Union stance and austerity policies.

headline.main: Ultra-Nationalist Resurgence Could Complicate Serbia's EU Path
headline.print_headline: Ultra-Nationalist Resurgence Could Complicate Serbia's EU Path

docs.snippet: In a nation where cows are both sacred and essential, camps have been set up to preserve them in a drought. But instead of dropping them off, the owners are staying....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a nation where cows are both sacred and essential, camps have been set up to preserve them in a drought. But instead of dropping them off, the owners are staying.
docs.abstract: Khilad Journal; government in India's Beed district, deep in heart of Maharashtra State, relies on temporary cattle camps to help farmers feed livestock as extended drought threatens food and availability of water; in village of Khilad, officials are struggling with unanticipated problem of farmers and their families choosing to stay in camps along with their cattle, living in conditions that are in many cases squalid and unsafe.

headline.main: Farmers in Arid India Share Camps With Their Cattle
headline.print_headline: Indian Farmers Take Their Hungry, Thirsty Cattle to Camp, and Stay

byline.contributor: Suhasini Raj contributed reporting from New Delhi.
